name: CreateStatusPagePost
description:
Create a status page post using a specific page ID.

This tool is used to create a post on a status page identified by its ID. Useful for updating status pages with the latest information. Requires `status_pages.write` permission.

parameters.name: status_page_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the status page to which the post will be added.

parameters.name: api_version_header
parameters.description: Specifies the API version using the `Accept` header for versioning.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: status_page_post_details
parameters.description: JSON object with details for creating the status page post, including title, type, and updates.

type.description: The type of the object returned by the API - in this case, a Status Page Post.

title.description: The title given to a Post.

starts_at.description: The date and time the Post intent becomes effective - only for maintenance post type.

ends_at.description: The date and time the Post intent is concluded - only for maintenance post type.

self.description: The path to which the Post Update resource is accessible.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object.

message.description: The message of the Post Update.

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object.
A string that determines the schema of the object.

id.description: An unique identifier within Status Page scope that defines a Service entry.

type.description: The type of the object returned by the API - in this case, a Status Page Service.

id.description: An unique identifier within Status Page scope that defines a Status Page Impact entry.

type.description: The type of the object returned by the API - in this case, a Status Page Impact.

impacted_services.description: Impacted services represent the status page services affected by a post update, and its impact.

update_frequency_ms.description: The frequency of the next Post Update in milliseconds.

notify_subscribers.description: Determines if the subscribers should be notified of the Post Update.

reported_at.description: The date and time the Post Update was reported.

type.description: The type of the object returned by the API - in this case, a Status Page Post Update.

updates.description: Post Updates to be associated with a Post

type.description: A string that determines the schema of the object.

post.description: Request schema for creating/updating a given Status Page Post resource.
